error.signature: error[E0502]: cannot borrow `x` as mutable because it is also borrowed as immutable
error.regex: error\[E0502\]: cannot borrow .+ as mutable because it is also borrowed as immutable

verdict.summary: Rust's borrow checker prevents simultaneous mutable and immutable borrows.

dead_ends.action: Use unsafe to bypass borrow checker
dead_ends.why_fails: Introduces undefined behavior, defeats Rust's safety guarantees
Unnecessary allocations, may not fix the design issue

workarounds.action: Restructure code to separate mutable and immutable borrow scopes
workarounds.how:
{ let r = &x; use(r); } // immutable borrow ends
x.mutate(); // mutable borrow starts

workarounds.action: Use interior mutability (RefCell, Mutex) when borrow splitting isn't possible

frequently_confused_with.distinction: E0382 is use-after-move; E0502 is simultaneous mutable+immutable borrow
